meanings.sent1: The old, moldy sandwich in the fridge looked really skeevy.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left on the street corner was so skeevy.
meanings.sent3: The slimy, green slime on the pond was quite skeevy.
meanings.sent4: The dark alley behind the building had a skeevy vibe.
meanings.sent5: The sticky, gooey substance felt skeevy to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The man lurking in the shadows seemed really skeevy.
meanings.sent2: The deal offered by the stranger felt a bit skeevy.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious package left on the doorstep was definitely skeevy.
meanings.sent4: The hidden agenda behind the proposal was quite skeevy.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky behavior of the cat seemed skeevy to the owner.

meanings.definition: To behave in a creepy or lecherous manner
meanings.sent1: He always skeevies around the office, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She skeevied her way into the party uninvited.
meanings.sent3: The way he leered at her was skeevying her out.
meanings.sent4: The creepy guy skeevied up to her at the bar.
meanings.sent5: His constant staring skeevied her to the point of leaving the room.
